You can create an TripleExponentialMovingAverage indicator that does not automatically update. This lets you update the indicator with any data you choose. The following reference table describes the TripleExponentialMovingAverage constructor.

TripleExponentialMovingAverage()1/2

            TripleExponentialMovingAverage QuantConnect.Indicators.TripleExponentialMovingAverage (
     string  name,
     int     period,
   )

Initializes a new instance of the TripleExponentialMovingAverage class using the specified name and period.

Parameters
string name The name of this indicator.
int period The period of the TEMA.

Return

TripleExponentialMovingAverage - The new TripleExponentialMovingAverage indicator object.

Definition at line 50 of file Indicators/TripleExponentialMovingAverage.cs.


You can update the indicator automatically or manually.

Automatic Update

Create a consolidator and then call the RegisterIndicator method to update the indicator with the consolidated bars.


private TripleExponentialMovingAverage _tema;

// In Initialize()
_tema = new TripleExponentialMovingAverage(name, period);
_tema.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
var symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _tema, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_tema.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _tema.Current.Value;
}
    
# In Initialize()
self.tema = TripleExponentialMovingAverage(name, period)
self.tema.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.tema, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.tema.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.tema.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually enables you to control when the indicator is updated and what data you use to update it. To manually update the indicator, call the Update method that with time/decimal pair. The indicator will only be ready after you prime it with enough data.

    
private TripleExponentialMovingAverage _tema;
private Symbol symbol;

// In Initialize()
_tema = new TripleExponentialMovingAverage(period);
symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;

// In OnData()
if (data.ContainsKey(_symbol))
{
    _tema.Update(data[symbol].EndTime, data[symbol].High);
}
if (_tema.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _tema.Current.Value;
}
    
# In Initialize()
self.tema = TripleExponentialMovingAverage(period)
self.symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol

# In OnData()
if data.ContainsKey(self.symbol):
    self.tema.Update(data[self.symbol].EndTime, data[self.symbol].High)
if self.tema.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.tema.Current.Value
